sentence.Network_cn: 那件上衣太短,让你的衬裙露出来了.

sentence.Network_en: I have to wear a petticoat under this skirt to prevent it from riding up when I move.
sentence.Network_cn: 我必须在裙子里面加一条衬裙,以防走动时裙子往上缩.

sentence.Network_en: I'll buy Mammy some red taffeta and have an elegant petticoat made. "
sentence.Network_cn: 我就给嬷嬷买块红府绸,让她做一条漂亮裙子吧.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from petty coat, literally 'small coat'

entry.def: A petticoat is a piece of clothing like a thin skirt, which is worn under a skirt or dress.
